issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
We are just seeing a facebook login button which tapping on does nothing & missing 'upload photos from gallery with graph API' & 'upload photos from file with REST API' .

Not a Regression, occurs with 2.0.2GA

Steps to reproduce:
1.Build kitchen sink for mobile web in titanium studio.
2.Type the ip address of your laptop into the mobile device's web browser.(safari for iphone & IE for windows phone). 
3.Hit go or enter.
4.Kitchen sink will fire up in the browser.
5.Tap on mashups tab.
6.Tap on the facebook table row.
7.Tap on the photos table row.
8.You will just see a facebook login page & tapping on it does not do anything,just an animation.
9.We are missing 'upload photos from gallery with graph API' & 'upload photos from file with REST API'.

Actual result:
1.We are just seeing a facebook login button which tapping on does nothing & are missing upload photos from gallery with graph API & upload photos from file with REST API .

Expected result:
1.Tapping on facebook login button should give us the login page.
2.Tapping on upload photos from gallery with graph API we should be able to upload a photo from gallery window.
3.Tapping on upload photos from file with REST API we should see should see an Alert :Success & On facebook page look for photo posted.
fields.summary: Mobile Web : Mashups-->facebook-->photos : Just seeing a facebook login button which tapping on does nothing & missing 'upload photos from gallery with graph API' & 'upload photos from file with REST API' .
fields.environment:
Titanium Studio : 2.1.0.201206071457
SDK Version : 2.1.0.v20120608070223
Iphone 4.3.4
windows phone mango

comments.body: Resolving ticket as Invalid as there is now a new version of Kitchen Sink available and we no longer support the version which relates to this ticket.
